Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: EQUIPMENT IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a specific peice of equipment.
Column Comment.2: EQUIPMENT OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for the occurence of theequipment in drilling operations.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.6: OFFSITE DATE: The date that this equipment was moved offsite for this occurence.Note that a new row of data is created if the equipment is used again, using a newobs no.
Column Comment.7: OFFSITE TIME: The time that this equipment was moved offsite for this occurence.Note that a new row of data is created if the equipment is used again, using a newobs no.
Column Comment.8: ONSITE DATE: The date that this equipment was moved onsite for this occurence.Note that a new row of data is created if the equipment is used again, using a newobs no.
Column Comment.9: ONSITE TIME: The time that this equipment was moved onsite for this occurence.Note that a new row of data is created if the equipment is used again, using a newobs no.
Column Comment.10: OPERATOR BA ID: Unique identifier for the business associate who is the operatorof this equipment. Could be the same as the owner, or the name of the party wholeased or rented the equipment.
Column Comment.11: PARENT EQUIPMENT ID: In the case where this equipment is part of a composite,the identifier for the master or parent piece of equipment.
Column Comment.12: PERIOD ON WELL: The total elapsed time that this drilling equipment was on thewell site.
Column Comment.14: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.15: REFERENCE NUMBER: a reference numbe for the peice of equipment used. Alsocaptured in the equipment table.
Column Comment.16: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.17: RENTED INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this peice of equipment was rented.
Column Comment.18: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.19: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.20: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.22: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.24: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
